name: Vegan Pear Upside Down Cake
description: Pear Upside Down Cake. This amazing Vegan Upside Down Cake needs just 1 Bowl and 40 mins. Use other fruits for variation. Vegan Nutfree Soyfree Recipe. GF option Makes 8 or 9 inch cake pan

video.description:
Vegan Pear Upside Down Cake. 1 Bowl and 40 mins. Use other fruits for variation.
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/02/vegan-pear-upside-down-cake.html
MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/books

This Upside Down Cake needs just 1 Bowl and 40 mins. A gooey caramelized top, soft delicious cake, a dollop of whipped coconut cream to serve. GF option in the notes. Made Several Times already by you all since getting posted!

The pears are sliced and arranged on the bottom of a pan. Maple syrup or brown sugar helps them caramelize during baking. Then a simple vanilla batter on top. Bake until done, then serve with some whipped coconut cream or vanilla ice cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Delish! Use the same method to make pineapple upside down cake or use peaches or apple.

recipeIngredient: 3 tbsp maple syrup  (or brown sugar for more caramelized, or half of each)
3/4 cup non dairy milk (such as almond, soy)
1/4 cup pear puree or applesauce ((I usually blend up leftover pear and use it))
1 tsp cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice or chai spice (or cinnamon + cardamom)
1.5 cups flour ((I use a mix of all purpose and wheat), see notes for Glutenfree)

recipeInstructions.text: Line a 8 or 9 inch cake pan with parchment at the bottom. Arrange pear slices as you like. Pour the maple syrup (or sprinkle the sugar) all over the pear slices. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180C)
recipeInstructions.name: Line a 8 or 9 inch cake pan with parchment at the bottom. Arrange pear slices as you like. Pour the maple syrup (or sprinkle the sugar) all over the pear slices. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180C)

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the remaining pear in a blender with 1-2 tsp of water until it is like applesauce. Measure out 1/4 cup of the puree and use in the cake. Or use applesauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend the remaining pear in a blender with 1-2 tsp of water until it is like applesauce. Measure out 1/4 cup of the puree and use in the cake. Or use applesauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all the wet ingredients in a bowl until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix all the wet ingredients in a bowl until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the baking powder, baking soda and salt into the flour. Add 1.25 cups flour to the wet and mix in. Add 1-2 tbsp more at a time to make a thick batter, not too stiff but not too flowy.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the baking powder, baking soda and salt into the flour. Add 1.25 cups flour to the wet and mix in. Add 1-2 tbsp more at a time to make a thick batter, not too stiff but not too flowy.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour gently on top of the pear slices in the cake pan and spread to even it out.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour gently on top of the pear slices in the cake pan and spread to even it out.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick from the enter comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick from the enter comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool for 15 mins, then remove cake by inverting it over a dish. Carefully peel off the parchment.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool for 15 mins, then remove cake by inverting it over a dish. Carefully peel off the parchment.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle a good pinch of cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice or other fave spice blend on the pears. Cool for another 10 mins, then slice and serve with whipped coconut cream or vegan ice cream
